snippet: Chrysler reported a 30 percent gain in new-vehicle sales for May, Ford said its sales climbed 13 percent and General Motors reported an 11 percent increase.
abstract: Automakers announce that they sold 1.33 million vehicles in the United States in May, a 25.7 percent increase over the same month one year earlier; turnaround has given the auto industry enough confidence to add jobs and increase production, making it a rare bright spot in an otherwise grim employment picture.
lead_paragraph: Chrysler reported a 30 percent gain in new-vehicle sales for May, Ford said its sales climbed 13 percent and General Motors reported an 11 percent increase.

headline.seo: May Car Sales Keep Up Healthy Pace
headline.main: Auto Sales Rose in May, Continuing a Bright Trend
headline.print_headline: Auto Sales Rose in May, Continuing a Bright Trend
